intro: Triumfetta trachystema, commonly known as the rough-leaved triumfetta, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Middle East. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers and hairy, rough-textured leaves. It typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showing some degree of drought tolerance. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, wind-dispersed seeds.
